comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

I choose not to use tab browsing, my home page is about:blank. Opened the Add-Ons menu. It opens the add-ons page in the current window, hide the URL bar and there is no way to get back to Home other than close & re-open browser or from firefox menu choose new tab. This is not the same behavior as when tab browsing is on or there is a page other than blank page open. 


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the preference, turn off tab browsing (always show tab bar)
2. Set home page to blank page
3. open the add-on page from firefox menu
4. Firefox would paint the add-ons on the current window
5. Home button is gone...
Actual Results:  
Home button is gone.

Expected Results:  
I would expect the add-on page to open in a new window or tab.
